name: Hyatt Place El Paso Airport

reviews.text: We stayed here as part of a conference in town; the conference sponsors had already booked us here.
reviews.title: Very Good Service and Accommodations
Overbooked
reviews.text: Our experience was excellent. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was spacious, large enough for us to have a meeting before our presentation. The countertops were granite with a wet bar and fridge, and the TV was huge. The room oozed comfort and thoughtfulness, and it was clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we reported that our coffeemaker was not working, Josh, an employee, courteously brought a replacement to our room within five minutes of our call to the front desk, and he plugged it in and tried it out to make sure it worked. That's service!
reviews.title: Large room with nice touches
Being Fan of Hyatt Place
reviews.text: The continental breakfast was adequate. The whole idea of semi-fast food for purchase in the lobby seemed a bit awkward, but I suppose it would work well for a harried traveler. Also, highway noise was noticeable but not overwhelming in our room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the room a month ago as a part of 7 day road trip and they were overbooked that ruined our trip.
reviews.title: Great staff, nice rooms

likes.liked: — Large rooms, huge TVs, helpful staff

reviews.text: A group of us stayed at this hotel because it was near the location of our meeting and the airport. They graciously arranged early check-in. (Really early, like 9:30 or 10:00 a.m.) And they had welcome baskets for our group. Nice. The shuttle took us to our meeting and to the airport. Nice.
reviews.title: OK Business trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But when I got to my room on the 6th and top floor, my key cards didn't work. I've been traveling a lot lately and that happens about 50% of the time. The higher and farther away your room is, the more likely you'll have to take your luggage back down and get new keys, no matter what hotel chain you're in.
reviews.title: Trendy and Good Value

reviews.text: Breakfast was OK, Starbucks coffee is a waste of their money, in my opinion. I'd go back.
reviews.title: Fell In Love

reviews.text: My wife and I arranged our stay through a last-minute same day booking on priceline.com. We got a decent rate, and knew nothing about the hotel. We were pleasantly surprised. The decor is trendy and modern, and the hotel looks crisp and clean after new renovations. Previous reviewers' criticisms about the elevator having graffiti and the bathrooms being small were true, but those details seemed insignificant to me. The rooms had very nice amenities, including a sectional couch, plasma television, fridge, and very comfortable beds. My only criticism is that the pool water is so cold, it is unusable - even on days with temperatures exceeding 100 degrees.
reviews.title: OK, but Will Try Elsewhere Next Time

reviews.text: As soon as I walked in I knew I had made the right decision. The hotel was absolutely beautiful, up to date, contemporary, clean, professional. The lobby offered 24 hour cafe with premade sandwiches, drinks, etc. There wasn't any room service but there was a microwave and minifridge in room.
reviews.title: Nice surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I checked in to the Hyatt Place El Paso after having an extremely bad experience at another hotel. For the first night of my trip, I was staying alone and wanted somewhere that I could feel safe and receive excellent service. The Hyatt Place surpassed my expectations and was extremely reasonably priced too. From the moment I walked through the door, the employees were professional, gave excellent service, and accommodated my every need . My husband and I spent 6 nights in this hotel and really enjoyed evertyhing about this hotel. The rooms are large, the bed is comfortable, the water pressure and shower is perfect, and I couldn't hear any of our neighbors or anyone in the hallway at all. The breakfast is what you can expect from a free continental breakfast, but you can order from the kitchen if you want something else or IHOP and Denny's are right down the street (within walking distance). The food at the front counter is expensive, but it tastes really good and if you don't feel like going out, it is convenient. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and again and wouldn't even consider another hotel in El Paso.
reviews.title: A Pleasant Surprise

reviews.text: I stayed at this location due to Hyatt's stay two night's get 3 Southwest Airlines Credits. I usually stay at a Holiday Inn Express a few miles east, and honestly will continue to do so, unless there is a great promotion like this one. This Hyatt Place is about what I expected, a rebranded Amerisuites. They put a polish on the rooms but the footprint is still the same.
reviews.title: Not Bad, though not a fan of the Hyatt Place "concept"

reviews.text: The lobby is in good condition and very welcoming with the open flow concept typical of all Hyatt Places'. On the first floor is the breakfast area as well as the area that serves as the dining area. Also there is a small business center with two PC's. There is a small swimming pool and guest laundry. The staff was acceptable. The free continental breakfast is about on par with a Days Inn….very limited and in my opinion designed to try and get you to buy their hot items. (for a rather high price) They have bagels, toast, cereal, milk, juice, and some cut fruit. No hot items and no pastries. I did partake of the evening food one night and got a decent sandwich and chips (semi fast food?) for $9. They have a pretty decent selection of food options and a small bar.
reviews.title: Visit to Hyatt Place El Paso

reviews.text: There is an adequate exercise room, though I There are two treadmills, an elliptical, and a bicycle. The equipment does have TV's built into them, which is nice, though most of the major networks do not come in so makes it kind of a waste during prime time TV.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay, staff is really friendly and helpful

reviews.text: My room was a King room with a divided living room, but no door. The bathroom is incredibly cramped in the tub / toilet area, you have to wiggle behind the door to close it. Tiles look a bit grungy around the tub. You could not watch TV from the work desk so for a business traveler it was less than ideal. Rooms have a refrigerator and comfortable climate control system. Room was spotless, smelled fresh and had nice pillows. The room has a great HD TV with plenty of channels.
reviews.title: Sweet

reviews.text: Got this through Priceline at a bid of $50 per night for a 2 night stay. Turned out to be quite a bit nicer than I expected. First, it had the trifecta every hotel ought to have: free parking, free wireless internet, and free breakfast. In addition the room was huge, with two distinct zones: a sleeping zone and a work/eat/lounge zone. Huge flat screen TV could be seen from either area. Comfortable beds and linens. Room was clean and modern and well equipped. Bathroom was generic but just fine. They had 24 hour food -- nothing special, but you could get a burger and beer anytime. And the staff was very nice and friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Unexpectedly nice, great service
Pleasant stay.
reviews.text: Cool tech-y hotel, conveniently located near the airport. Friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms and very cool 42 inch plasma tvs. I really liked the sitting area in all the rooms. Very easy to lounge around watching tv or curl up with a book.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a room on a Saturday for $80, which seemed like a good deal for this class of hotel/area.
reviews.title: another great Hyatt Place

reviews.text: Only two minor complaints:
reviews.title: Unfriendly staff

reviews.text: 1) Airport shuttle doesn't run until 7 am (though they said they might be able to arrange something else for us)
reviews.title: What a beautiful room!

aka: Hyatt Place El Paso Airport Hotel
